workflow.name: Predict customer churn risk & create interventions with GPT-4, Zendesk & HubSpot
workflow.description:
How it works
This AI Customer Success Risk Prediction workflow revolutionizes customer retention by predicting churn risk 30-90 days before it happens. Here's the high-level flow:
Daily Data Collection â†’ AI Multi-Signal Analysis â†’ Risk Scoring & Prediction â†’ Smart Risk Routing â†’ AI-Generated Personalized Interventions â†’ CRM Updates & Team Alerts
The system automatically gathers data from your product analytics, support system, billing platform, and email tools, then uses GPT-4 to analyze patterns and predict which customers are at risk. It creates personalized intervention strategies and routes them based on urgency level.
Set up steps
Time to set up: Approximately 45 minutes
Prerequisites: Active accounts with your analytics platform, support system, billing provider, CRM, and AI provider
Step 1: Import & Configure Workflow (5 minutes)

Import the workflow JSON into your n8n instance
Review the 3 comprehensive sticky notes for context
Understand the AI analysis logic and intervention strategies

Step 2: Set Environment Variables (10 minutes)
Configure these critical variables:

ANALYTICS_API_URL and ANALYTICS_API_KEY
HIGH_RISK_SLACK_CHANNEL (for critical alerts)
CS_TEAM_EMAIL (intervention sender)
CRM_BASE_URL and CALENDAR_BOOKING_URL

Step 3: Configure API Credentials (20 minutes)
Set up secure credential connections for:

OpenAI/Anthropic API (AI analysis engine)
Analytics platform (Mixpanel/Amplitude/GA)
Support system (Zendesk/Intercom)
Billing platform (Stripe/Chargebee)
HubSpot CRM (risk data storage)
Slack API (team notifications)
SMTP/SendGrid (email delivery)

Step 4: Customize AI Prompts & Risk Thresholds (8 minutes)

Review and adjust the AI analysis prompts for your business
Modify risk score thresholds (Critical 90+, High 70-89, Medium 40-69)
Customize intervention email templates and tone
Set your specific risk factors (usage patterns, support indicators)

Step 5: Test & Activate (2 minutes)

Run a test execution with sample customer data
Verify AI analysis generates appropriate risk scores
Check that interventions are routed correctly
Activate the daily cron schedule

parameters.content:
## ðŸ”® AI Customer Success Risk Prediction Workflow

**Purpose:** Predict customer churn risk 30-90 days early using AI analysis of multiple data signals, then automatically create personalized interventions

**Why This is Revolutionary:**
- Most CS teams are reactive - this is predictive
- Combines product usage + support sentiment + billing patterns
- AI generates personalized interventions based on specific risk factors
- Reduces churn by 15-30% through early intervention

**ðŸ” Security:** All API keys stored in environment variables and credentials

## ðŸŽ¯ Setup & Configuration

**Required Environment Variables:**
- `MIXPANEL_PROJECT_ID` (or analytics tool)
- `HIGH_RISK_SLACK_CHANNEL`
- `CS_TEAM_EMAIL`
- `OPENAI_MODEL_VERSION`

**Credentials Needed:**
- OpenAI/Anthropic API (AI analysis)
- Analytics Platform (Mixpanel/Amplitude)
- Support System (Zendesk/Intercom)
- Stripe/Billing System
- HubSpot CRM
- Slack API
- SendGrid/Email Platform

**Setup Time:** ~45 minutes

## ðŸ§  AI Risk Analysis Logic

**Data Sources Combined:**
- Product usage trends (logins, feature usage, session duration)
- Support ticket sentiment & frequency
- Payment patterns & billing issues
- Email engagement rates
- Contract renewal dates

**AI Scoring Factors:**
- Usage decline >30% = High risk
- Negative support sentiment = Medium risk
- Payment delays = High risk
- Low email engagement = Low risk modifier
- Multiple signals = Exponential risk increase

**Risk Levels:** Critical (90+), High (70-89), Medium (40-69), Low (<40)

parameters.text: ðŸš¨ CRITICAL CUSTOMER RISK ALERT ðŸš¨

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
